evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On February 7, 2025, President Trump named Office of Management and Budget Director Russell Vought as the Acting Director of the CFPB.

extracted.value: On February 7, 2025, President Trump named Russell Vought as Acting Director of the CFPB.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The Trump administration in general and Defendant Acting Director Vought in particular have made no secret of their desire to dissolve the CFPB.

extracted.value: The Trump administration and Acting Director Vought desire to dissolve the CFPB.

evidence.text: appointed Russell Vought to serve as Acting Director of the CFPB.

extracted.value: Russell Vought was appointed Acting Director of the CFPB.

evidence.text: Of these unobligated funds, $220,000,000.00 was internally earmarked for an operating reserve (“Reserve Fund”). The remaining $192,346,065.32 represented the CFPB’s operating balance.

extracted.value: Vought reviewed a spreadsheet showing the Bureau Fund balance of $412,346,065.32 and a reserve of $220,000,000.00.

evidence.text: I have determined that no additional funds are necessary to carry out the authorities of the Bureau for Fiscal Year 2025.

extracted.value: Vought determined the funds were sufficient for the next fiscal quarter.

evidence.text: On behalf of the Bureau, Mr. Vought sent Jerome Powell, Chair of the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, a letter dated February 8, 2025, requesting zero dollars for the third quarter of fiscal year 2025.

extracted.value: Vought sent a letter to Jerome Powell dated February 8, 2025, requesting zero dollars for the third quarter of fiscal year 2025.

evidence.text: Mr. Vought sent an “all-hands” email to CFPB employees instructing them not to perform certain rulemaking, investigative, litigation, public relations, contracting, and monitoring functions.

extracted.value: Vought sent an all-hands email instructing employees not to perform certain functions.

evidence.text: The next day, the CFPB’s Chief Operating Officer, Adam Martinez, sent another email to CFPB employees announcing that the Bureau’s headquarters in Washington, D.C. would be closed from February 10 through February 14.

extracted.value: COO Adam Martinez sent an email announcing the closure of the CFPB headquarters from February 10 through February 14.

evidence.text: On February 10, Mr. Martinez sent another email to Bureau employees directing them not to “perform any work tasks.”

extracted.value: Vought sent an email on February 10 directing employees not to perform any work tasks.

evidence.text: In a letter dated January 17, 2018, then-Acting Director Mick Mulvaney requested zero dollars for the second quarter of fiscal year 2018.

extracted.value: In 2018, Acting Director Mick Mulvaney requested zero dollars for the second quarter of fiscal year 2018.

evidence.text: In NTEU, a diverse set of organizational plaintiffs and one individual plaintiff brought suit against Defendants seeking injunctive relief to prevent the shutdown of the CFPB and to require the Bureau to continue operating.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs brought a suit (NTEU) to prevent the shutdown of the CFPB and to require it to continue operating.

evidence.text: As of the date of this Memorandum, the preliminary injunction motion in NTEU remains pending.

extracted.value: The plaintiffs’ motion for a preliminary injunction is pending.

evidence.source_document: Plaintiff's Memorandum of Points and Authorities in Support of Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: On February 8, 2025, Mr. Musk had posted “CFPB RIP” to social media and commented in a reply to the post that CFPB “need[s] to go.”

extracted.value: On February 8, 2025, Vought posted “CFPB RIP” on X.com.

evidence.source_document: Plaintiff's Memorandum of Points and Authorities in Support of Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: Plaintiffs allege that Defendant Vought is seeking to transfer the Bureau’s reserve fund back to the Federal Reserve.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs allege that Vought seeks to transfer the CFPB’s reserve fund back to the Federal Reserve.
